title: SRK, Sallu, RK turn to Ajay Devgn for VFX
text:
The actor's newly launched company will design the effects for the actors upcoming films.
READ: 'Salman Khan', 'Shah Rukh Khan' on sale in goat markets
Actor-producer-director, Ajay Devgn has added another feather to his cap. The 44 year old, who flies off to film his next production, Shivaay, in Mussoorie, in November, has invested in a VFX studio named after his 12-year-old daughter Nysa and five-year-old son Yug.
The company's special effects wing has a line-up of films for 2015, beginning with Ranbir Kapoor and Deepika Padukone's upcoming movie, which opens next month. The company is also working on Christmas releases like Sanjay Leela Bhansali's Bajirao Mastani, featuring Ranveer Singh, Deepika Padukone and Priyanka Chopra, and Rohit Shetty's Dilwale, with Shah Rukh Khan, Kajol, Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon.
His new company will manage the post-production of Shivaay, whose action-sequences will be filmed in the snow-capped mountains of Bulgaria. Ajay, who is prepping up for the film will also be shooting Milan Luthria's slice-of-life drama, Baadshao, simultaneously.
"Apart from these films, Ajay's company is also working on the visual effects of Salman Khan's Diwali dhamaka, Prem Ratan Dhan Payo, and is taking up many television and regional projects this year as well. A VFX company was always on Ajay's mind and he has finally launched it," the actor's spokesperson informed.
